inclusion.criterion: Age 18 and older than 18 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Anti-HCV (Abbott HCV EIA 2.0, Abbott Diagnostic, Chicago, IL) positive > 6 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Detectable serum quantitative HCV-RNA (Cobas Taqman v2.0, Roche Diagnostics)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Serum alanine aminotransferase levels above the upper limit of normal with 6 months of enrollment
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A liver biopsy consistent with the diagnosis of chronic hepatitis C
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Receive 24 or 48 weeks of PEG-IFN alfa plus ribavirin (1,000 mg/day for BW < 75 kg; 1,200 mg/day for BW ≥ 75 kg for HCV genotype 1; 800 mg/day for HCV genotype 2)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: On IFN, RBV and direct antiviral drugs for the past 6 months
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Anemia (hemoglobin < 13 gram per deciliter for men and < 12 gram per deciliter for women)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Co-infection with hepatitis B virus (HBV) or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Mixed HCV genotype 1 with other genotype infection
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Chronic alcohol abuse (daily consumption > 20 gram per day)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Decompensated liver disease (Child-Pugh class B or C)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Serum creatinine level more than 1.5 times the upper limit of normal
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of HCV and recent coinfection with HBV, but is otherwise healthy.
